title: Irrelevant warning about mismatch between groups and projects
body:
### Describe the bug

```
An openshift deployment was requested, but the container image group:xxx is not aligned with the currently selected project:default. It is strongly advised to align them, or else the image might not be reachable.
```
The warning above should only appear when the following conditions are met:

- Mismatch between container image group and target namespace 
- Target deployment target is openshift 
- In cluster build that produces an ImageStreamTag is used (s2i binary, docker build strategy)

However, I can reproduce it even when the last two conditions are not meet.

### Expected behavior

No warning should appear when we are not using openshift.

### Actual behavior

```
An openshift deployment was requested, but the container image group:xxx is not aligned with the currently selected project:default. It is strongly advised to align them, or else the image might not be reachable.
```

### How to Reproduce?

Reproducer:

```
quarkus create app hello-quarkus
quarkus ext add -B kubernetes, container-image-docker
cd hello-quarkus
mvn clean install -Dquarkus.kubernetes.deploy=true -Dquarkus.container-image-group=testme
```

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

_No response_

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

_No response_

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_
